items.title: No reaction when I click the 'View' button
items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version:1.2.1
* Python version:3.7.1
* Operating System:Windows10 1903

### Description

When I tried to click the 'View' button in the generated html to know more information about my failed testcases , I can't get anything (no reaction).
I did write the program in the format of your sample program. So I'd like to know if there are any method to solve this problem?

### What I Did

```
example_test=unittest.TestLoader().loadTestsFromTestCase(TestCase1)
suite=unittest.TestSuite([example_test])
h=HTMLTestRunner(output='E:/', \
              combine_reports=True,\
              report_name='MyTestCase2',\
              report_title='TestCase2',\
              descriptions='Just For Fun',\
              add_timestamp=False).run(suite)
```

items.title: update Jinja2 version
items.body:
### Description

Cannot run HtmlTestRunner on the lastest version of Jinja templating. 

htmlTestRunner 1.1.2 has requirement Jinja2==2.9.5, but you'll have jinja2 2.10 which is incompatible.

items.title: Is there a way to see the assertions of a test
items.body:
I'm wondering if there is a way to provide all the assertions within a test code in the output. Right now it seems that the following pseudo code:

```python
 def test_func(self):
    assert 1 == 1
    assert 1 == 2
```

Would result in the output


test_func | Fail | Hide
-- | -- | --
AssertionError:Traceback (most recent call last): File "add_person.py", line 56, in test_valid_demographics assert 1 == 2 AssertionError

I'm trying to get a single TC to list all the steps within that test. Something like this 
[output](http://tungwaiyip.info/software/sample_test_report.html)


minds.cgibin.test.test_weblibMultiForm.TestWeblibMultiForm | 6 | 6 | 0 | 0 | Detail
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
test_GET | pass
test_POST_add | pass
test_POST_add_new_tag | pass
test_POST_illegal_tag | pass
test_POST_input_escape | pass
test_POST_remove | pass

Is this currently possible

runner.outsuffix = None
```

I saw [here](https://github.com/oldani/HtmlTestRunner/blob/master/HtmlTestRunner/result.py#L334) that if the outsufiix is None or False, timestamp won't be added.

However, I get the following errror:

```
  File "C:\Users\lyubomir.papazov\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\site-packages\HtmlTestRunner\result.py", line 312, in _report_tests
    testcase_name = test_class_name.split("_")[1]
IndexError: list index out of range

items.title: How can i solve testcase name displayed unreadable
items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version: 1.1.2
* Python version:3.7
* Operating System:windows 10

### Description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38344643/46543465-83e17880-c8f3-11e8-9ab2-020b0a601238.png)



### What I Did

# -*- coding:utf-8 -*-
import requests
import unittest
import HtmlTestRunner
import json
class RequestTest(unittest.TestCase):
    def setUp(self):
        self.url = "http://zzk.cnblogs.com/s/blogpost"
    def test_request(self):
        '''找找看搜索功能'''
        par = {"Keywords": "yoyoketang"}
        result = requests.get('http://zzk.cnblogs.com/s/blogpost', params=par)
        code = result.status_code
        print(result.text)
        self.assertEqual(code,200,"相等")
        assert "博客园" in result.text
if __name__ == '__main__':
    filename = "report.html"
    unittest.main(testRunner=HtmlTestRunner.HTMLTestRunner(output=filename))

items.title: Can't Combine tests reports in one HTML report
items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version: 1.1.2
* Python version: Python 3.6.5
* Operating System: MacOS 10.11

### Description

Hi,
I'm trying to get all my tests results combined in one file. At the moment, everything is separated according to each tests. I read about a new argument in HTMLTestRunner - combine_reports=True, which makes normally all combined in one report.
However I got an error. This  keyword argument is not known from HTMLTestRunner.
Below, the code I tried. It's coming from JamesMTSloan commented on May 8 2018.

### What I Did

```
import unittest
from HtmlTestRunner import HTMLTestRunner

unittest.main(
    testRunner=HTMLTestRunner(
        combine_reports=True,
        add_timestamp=False,
        report_name="MyReports"
    )
)

TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'combine_reports'

```
Thank you for your time,
Have a nice day!

items.title: Module Names with Underscores
items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version: 1.1.2
* Python version: 3.6.4
* Operating System: Windows 10

When unittest module names contain underscores the name in the test report (within the html file) is only everything prior to the first underscore..

```
import HtmlTestRunner
import unittest

class example_name_with_underscore(unittest.TestCase):
    """the test report for this module will contain the name example within the html file"""

    def test_upper(self):
        self.assertEqual('foo'.upper(), 'FOO')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    suite = unittest.TestLoader().loadTestsFromTestCase(example_name_with_underscore)
    runner = HtmlTestRunner.HTMLTestRunner(output='example_dir')
    runner.run(suite)
```

items.title: Enhancement - Failure and Error Tracebacks
items.body:
Enhancement - Failure and Error Tracebacks
* HtmlTestRunner version: 1.1.2
* Python version: 2.7.12 and 3.6.4
* Operating System: Windows 10 and Mint Linux

When a test fails or experiences an error only very limited information about the failure is stored in the report html page. The traceback is printed to console but is not preserved in the html page. One way to obtain this information is demonstrated below where the _exc_str contains the traceback. Can HtmlTestRunner be updated to add this information to the html report.


    def addFailure(self, test, err):

        self.failure_count += 1

        TestResult.addFailure(self, test, err)

        _, _exc_str = self.failures[-1]

items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version:1.1.1

* Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS

### Description

I'm trying to run an example test class where the setUpClass raises exception.
When it comes to the generating HTML part, HtmlTestRunner crashed.

### What I Did
```
python selftest/myTest.py
Running tests... 
----------------------------------------------------------------------

======================================================================
ERROR [0.000000s]: setUpClass (__main__.Example)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "selftest/myTest.py", line 8, in setUpClass
    raise Exception("Exception in setup class")
Exception: Exception in setup class
hello world

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 0 tests in 0:00:00

FAILED
 (Errors=1)

Generating HTML reports... 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "selftest/myTest.py", line 21, in <module>
    unittest.main(testRunner=HtmlTestRunner.HTMLTestRunner(output='example_dir'))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/unittest/main.py", line 95, in __init__
    self.runTests()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/unittest/main.py", line 232, in runTests
    self.result = testRunner.run(self.test)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/HtmlTestRunner/runner.py", line 95, in run
    result.generate_reports(self)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/HtmlTestRunner/result.py", line 339, in generate_reports
    testRunner)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/HtmlTestRunner/result.py", line 316, in _report_tests
    tests = self.sort_test_list(tests)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/HtmlTestRunner/result.py", line 303, in sort_test_list
    return sorted(test_list, key=self.get_test_number)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/HtmlTestRunner/result.py", line 295, in get_test_number
    test_number = int(test_name.split('_')[1])
IndexError: list index out of range
```
Test code:
import unittest
import HtmlTestRunner

class Example(unittest.TestCase):
    @classmethod
    def setUpClass(cls):
        print "hello world"
        raise Exception("Exception in setup class")

    def test_1(self):
        self.assertTrue(1==1)
    def test_2(self):
        self.assertTrue(2==2)
    @classmethod
    def tearDownClass(cls):
        print "Tearing down class"



if __name__ == "__main__":
    unittest.main(testRunner=HtmlTestRunner.HTMLTestRunner(output='example_dir'))

items.title: HtmlTestRunner cannot be directly used with Django DiscoverRunner
items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version: 1.1.0
* Python version: 3.6.1
* Operating System: Arch Linux

### Description

Because `output` is a required parameter, `HtmlTestRunner` cannot be used with Django.
### What I Did

The way I managed to make Django use `HtmlTestRunner` was to make a wrapper class.
```
from django.test.runner import DiscoverRunner
from HtmlTestRunner import HTMLTestRunner


class MyRunner(HTMLTestRunner):
    def __init__(self, **kwargs):
        super().__init__(output="", **kwargs)


DiscoverRunner.test_runner = MyRunner
```

I can contribute the fix if we get down to what it should be. One solution would be to make the `output` parameter optional. Another: make a class factory function, something like

```
def makeclass(output: str) -> Type[HTMLTestRunner]:
    class MyRunner(HTMLTestRunner):
        def __init__(self, **kwargs):
            super().__init__(output=output, **kwargs)

    return MyRunner
```

What do you think?

items.title: HTMLTestRunner - Need Help to Integrate multiple Test cases which has multiple arguments
items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version:  "1.0.2"
* Python version: 3.0
* Operating System: Windows 7

Team,
I have a complex python Web Automation framework, which replicates 
exactly like the below structure. I am struggling to get a Report using 
HTMLTestRunner. Without a Report the automation framework won’t be 
complete. Could you please help me to implement a HTML Report for the below 
framework.
Your help is much much appreciated.

I have posted this question in forum as well.: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45035896/htmltestrunner-need-help-to-integrate-multiple-test-cases-which-has-multiple-a
Please guide me to generate a HTML Report for my Test Suite.
Thank you.
Shan

Here is the Code
Vehicle.py
```python
Class Vehicle(unittest.TestCase)
    def __init__(self): 
        testData = readExcel("testdata.xlsx")
    def execute_core()
        driver = webdriver.chrome()
        driver.get(URL)
        testSuite =unittest.TestSuite()
        runner1 = HTMLRunner.HTMLTestRunner()
        for i, row in testData.iterrows():
            testName = row['TestName']
            Action = row['Action']
            modName = row['Module']
            email = row['Email']
            testSuite.addTest(unittest.defaultTestLoader.loadTestsFromTestCase(Car.test_execute(driver, modName, Action, email))
    runner1.run(testSuite)
    unittest.TextTestRunner().run(testSuite)  
```

Car.py
```python
Class Car(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_execute(driver, modName, Action, email)
        if modName == "Blue":
            BlueCar.test_execute(driver, email)
        elif modName == "Red":
            RedCar.test_execute(driver, Action, modName)
        elif modName = "Yellow":
            YellowCar.test_execute(driver,modName)
```
BlueCar.py
```python
Class BlueCar(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_execute(driver, email):
        print("This is Blue Car Test Case with Parameters/Arguments")
```
RedCar.py
```python
Class RedCar(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_execute(driver, Action, modName):
        print("This is Red Car Test Case with Parameters/Arguments")
```
YellowCar.py
```python
Class YellowCar(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_execute(driver, modName):
        print("This is YellowCar Test Case with Parameters/Arguments")
```

items.title: combining results to one html report
items.body:
* HtmlTestRunner version: 1.0.3
* Python version: 2.7.12
* Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

### Description

Hi,
How is it possible to combine several test classes to create one html report?
i'm using unittest TestLoader to discover all test suites in my package:

    runner = HtmlTestRunner.HTMLTestRunner(output='reports')
    test_suite = unittest.TestLoader().discover('./', '*_test.py', '.')
    runner.run(test_suite)

Thanks,
Yitzchak.

items.title: Suggestion: Add junit like xml result file in addition to the html result
items.body:
I believe that it will be valuable to have **both** html(user readable) and xml(Jenkins readable) results at once.  
It is common case Jenkins to be used for managing test execution, but when failure happens html is the way to manually investigate the problem. However there is no framework providing both file at the same time. 
(There is HTML Report Jenkins plugin that will collect and present nicely the html report)
